subject: Re: [junit] contructor executed at each test method
msgSnippet: ... Yes. Each test runs in its own object to isolate it from the other tests. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger Diaspar Software Services
messageBody:
radu milos wrote:
>
> Hello ,
>
> As the subject says it, i found out that the
> constructor of a testCase get executed for every test
> method. Is this the normal behaviour ?

Yes. Each test runs in its own object to isolate it from the other tests.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
